result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua C Jelinek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during the term of probation or civil judgment.
*NO use or possession of any firearms.

*Turn over CCW permit within 30 days.
*Daniel J. to turn over firearm to Wauwatosa Police Department within 30 days.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

timeConds.notes:
*Huber privileges for work and treatment. Court stays report date to 08/04/15 by 4pm.
*Court does not object to defendant traveling out of state for work purposes only during probation.

supervisions.notes: If not paid, defendant to pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, bail on deposit if any, to apply, or a civil judgment will be issued in 1 year.
Huber release privileges for work. Credit for 65 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua C Jelinek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Received, signed and filed:
Order for additional release privileges denied.
Copies forwarded to parties on today's date.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. spc

Defendant Joshua C Jelinek in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Defendant Joshua C Jelinek in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI    

Probation having been revoked, sentencing proceeded.  
Statements by each counsel and the defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, with Huber Release priviliges for work, and with credit for 65 days time served.  

-If not paid, defendant to pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; or a civil judgment will be issued in 1 year.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief.
Original transcript of July 29, 2015 (Plea and Sentencing), received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: AMI

The Clerk of Court's Office was notified by counsel that the case was assigned in error to Judge Kremers.  After the court reviewed the file, Judge Kremers decided that he will keep this case for the sentencing after revocation hearing.
cab

Received from the Department of Corrections, Request for Sentencing After Revocation of Defendant's Probation. ami
The Clerk is in receipt of the Revocation Packet. Case calendared for a sentencing revocation hearing on March 29, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. in Br. 36.
ADA Ben Lindsay notified of the court date. The Public Defenders Office to appoint counsel for the defendant. Transcript of sentencing hearing ordered. Deputies in court informed of new date to have the defendant produced.

PURSUANT TO Felony Division Directive 04-03 dated December 15, 2004 -
Per succession calendar this case is assigned and forwarded to Br. 36, Judge Kremers for sentencing after revocation of probation.  
Sentencing transcript requested from court reporter on March 14, 2016.
Received from the Department of Corrections, Request for Sentencing After Revocation of Defendant's Probation.  jm

Defendant Joshua C Jelinek in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties. Additional statements by Daniel J.
Court ordered SENTENCE WITHHELD, with credit for 3 days time served, and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the 
following conditions:
 - Defendant is to serve 20 days in the House of Correction, condition time, with Huber Privileges for work and treatment. Court stays report date to 8-04-2015 by 4 pm.  
 - No use or possession of any firearms. 
 - Turn over CCW permit within 30 days. 
 - Daniel J. to turn over firearm to Wauwatosa Police Department within 30 days. 
 - Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
 - Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges during the term of probation or civil judgment.
 - Court does not object to defendant traveling out of state for work purposes only during probation.

filed:  Sentencing Referral Form, Notice of Right to Seek Postconciction Relief, Pretrial Sentence Credit

Defendant Joshua C Jelinek in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Morgan R. or the residence or place of employment

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserve Judge, Br.46.vb

Defendant Joshua C Jelinek in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.VB
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6-3-2015 at 1:30pm
